1. Acceptance of Terms

By registering for and accessing the APIs provided through this Developer Portal ("Portal"), you ("Developer") agree to comply with these Terms and Conditions ("Terms"). If you do not agree to these Terms, you must not use the Portal.

2. API Access and Usage

2.1 The Portal grants you a non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable licence to access and use the APIs solely for the purpose of developing, testing, and integrating your applications.

2.2 You must not:
  • Use the APIs for any unlawful, harmful, or fraudulent activity.
  • Reverse engineer, decompile, or modify the APIs.
  • Share your access credentials with others.

3. Registration and Account Security

3.1 You must provide accurate and complete information when registering.

3.2 You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials and for all activities that occur under your account.

4. Rate Limiting and Fair Usage

4.1 We may implement rate limits to ensure fair usage.

4.2 Exceeding rate limits may result in suspension or termination of your access.

5. Intellectual Property

5.1 We retain all rights, title, and interest in and to the APIs and related documentation.

5.2 You retain ownership of any applications you develop using the APIs, subject to our rights in the APIs themselves.

6. Data Privacy

6.1 By using the APIs, you may receive or collect personal data. You must handle such data in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.

6.2 We may collect certain usage data to monitor and improve the APIs. Our Privacy Policy outlines how we handle such information.

7. Support and Availability

7.1 We strive to maintain availability of the APIs but do not guarantee uninterrupted service.

7.2 We reserve the right to modify, suspend, or discontinue the APIs with prior notice where feasible.

8. Termination

8.1 We reserve the right to terminate or suspend your access to the APIs at any time if you violate these Terms.

8.2 You may terminate your account by ceasing to use the APIs and notifying us in writing.

9. Limitation of Liability

9.1 To the maximum extent permitted by law, we shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising from your use of the APIs.

10. Changes to Terms

10.1 We reserve the right to modify these Terms at any time. Changes will be effective upon posting on the Portal.

10.2 Continued use of the APIs after changes constitutes your acceptance of the updated Terms.

11. Governing Law

These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [Insert Jurisdiction].

By registering and using the APIs, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to these Terms and Conditions.
